ARABIC: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They have no food but a bitter thorny bush
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will have no food except bitter thorn,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They shall have no food except bitter dry thorns
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will have no food other than bitter and thorny fruit
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: There is no food for them except thorns of fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: No food will there be for them but from Dari`,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They shall have no food but of thorns,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: no food for them but cactus thorn
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: No food for them save bitter thorn-fruit
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: they shall have no food but thorns,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: No food shall be theirs save bitter thorn,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They will have no food except cactus,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: No food will there be for them but a bitter Dhari'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: No food will there be for them but a poisonous thorny plant,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: no food for them except thorny plants
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They will have no food except thorns.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [88:6] They will have no food except cactus (darī‘) — a type of thorn plant which no animal grazes on because of its vileness —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (No food for them) in those abysmal pits (save bitter thorn fruit) the shabraq plant which grows in the roads of Mecca, which is eaten by camels when it is soft but when it is hard it becomes like the claws of cats.
